page.title: 14CHESWICK GREEN
page.content: Cheswick Green was built on a seventy acre site by Greaves Limited as a complete village with shops,a pub,a village green,an assembly hall and a primary school. Old manuscripts say that Cheswick Green was once the site of an early Saxon settlement. In 1904 the site was developed into a 'Pleasure Ground'with a refreshment room and ballroom.Shrubs were planted and a garden walk created along with a maze. After the Second World War people bombed out of their homes moved into the holiday cottages and bungalows that had been constructed on the site between the wars. In 1968 Greaves Limited bought the land for one million pounds.Today the village is still growing with new houses being built all the time.
